definitions.text: a relatively small granular particle of a substance
foodstuff prepared from the starchy grains of cereal grasses
the side of leather from which the hair has been removed
a weight unit used for pearls or diamonds: 50 mg or 1/4 carat
1/60 dram; equals an avoirdupois grain or 64.799 milligrams
1/7000 pound; equals a troy grain or 64.799 milligrams
dry seed-like fruit produced by the cereal grasses: e.g. wheat, barley, Indian corn

examples: wheat is a grain that is grown in Kansas

definitions.text: the smallest possible unit of anything
examples: there was a grain of truth in what he said
he does not have a grain of sense

definitions.text: the direction, texture, or pattern of fibers found in wood or leather or stone or in a woven fabric
examples: saw the board across the grain

definitions.text: the physical composition of something (especially with respect to the size and shape of the small constituents of a substance)
examples: breadfruit has the same texture as bread
fish with a delicate flavor and texture
His hands were grained with dirt

definitions.text: paint (a surface) to make it look like stone or wood
